result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon J Barber

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Barber in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Devon J Barber. 
Attorney Zima gives the court the sentencing recommendation. Attorney Jakobson gives the court a statement regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the court regarding sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for a Speedy Trial
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on July 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:48 AM Defendant Devon J Barber in court, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Devon J Barber. 
Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. Not guilty pleas are entered. Attorney Jakobson requests a Speedy Trial on both of the defendants cases. Bond is continued. Case 22CF245 will have trial first. 
Court denies any modification of bond.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from defendant requesting a bond modification

10:32 AM Defendant Devon J Barber appeared by phone in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Devon J Barber. Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews a letter sent by Devon Barber. Court informs everyone he will not be changing or modifying anything but clarifying his order today. Court goes over a program the defendant has found and clarifies what would happen if he were able to go to treatment. Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

8:42 AM Defendant Devon J Barber in court, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Devon J Barber. 
Officer did not show up today for the preliminary hearing due to the Officer being out today due to an injury. The State was not notified of this happening. Court finds good cause to go out of time limits and would like to re-schedule this again before dismissing. 
Bond is continued.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with victim or their residence. - DS. Absolute sobriety. $2500
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact w/victim or their residence - DS. Absolute sobriety.

2:09 PM Defendant Devon J Barber appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared by phone for Devon J Barber. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. 
Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court cancels warrant.
9:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Barber not in court.   Warrant ordered. Body only.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. 22-5735 $2000
